<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents an incoming formal argument to a Function. A formal</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// argument, since it is &#96;&#96;formal&#39;&#39;, does not contain an actual value but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instead represents the type, argument number, and attributes of an argument</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for a specific function. When used in the body of said function, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// argument of course represents the value of the actual argument that the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function was called with.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
